page.title: 01BELSAY:GENERAL INFORMATION
page.content: { { { Belsay}is a small village situated 15 miles Northwest of Newcastle on the main A696 route through to Jedburgh. The area, being rural, is principally a farming area, the main landowner being the{Belsay Estate,}originally owned by the{Middleton}family. The main arcade of houses and shops is built from honey-coloured stone containing flecks of iron quarried locally. The homes under the arcade were originally small shops but are now owner-occupied houses. The school, another focal point in the village, is used for the education of young children aged from 4 to 9. It is in fact the second building, the first now a private dwelling on the Morpeth Road.
